1.text: Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,

2.text: As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

3.text: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord [is] gracious.

4.text: To whom coming, [as unto] a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, [and] precious,

5.text: Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

6.text: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

7.text: Unto you therefore which believe [he is] precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

8.text: And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, [even to them] which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

9.text: But ye [are] a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

10.text: Which in time past [were] not a people, but [are] now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

11.text: Dearly beloved, I beseech [you] as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

12.text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by [your] good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

13.text: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lordâ€™s sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

14.text: Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

15.text: For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

16.text: As free, and not using [your] liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

17.text: Honour all [men]. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

18.text: Servants, [be] subject to [your] masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

19.text: For this [is] thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

20.text: For what glory [is it], if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer [for it], ye take it patiently, this [is] acceptable with God.

21.text: For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

22.text: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

23.text: Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed [himself] to him that judgeth righteously:

24.text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

25.text: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.
